Identify the first line that contains at least two non-empty comma-separated fields and treat it as the header; keep subsequent rows only until a line with <2 non-empty cells appears (handles messy extra footers).
Strip whitespace, remove commas and dollar signs, interpret K / M suffixes as ×1 000 or ×1 000 000, and cast to int/float where possible (ensures numeric '# of Reports' values).
Trim and lower-case the entries in the ‘Year’ column to standardise text values.

Because in the CSV’s two key columns are swapped, get credit card related reports for 2020 and 2024 by matching where df['Theft Type'] equals the numeric year and df['Year'] equals the (lower-cased) theft-type string to extract the “# of Reports” value.
Using Credit Card fraud counts for 2020 and 2024, compute and print the ratio (2024 count ÷ 2020 count).
